metadata.title: bodkan/slendr: slendr 1.2.0
metadata.description:
• Due to new issues related to conda activating environments in an incorrect path which started to pop up (possibly due to a misfeature in the reticulate package), activating procedure in slendr was reverted to a slower, but apparently more robust approach. This will unfortunately make running massively parallelized simulations on Windows problematic due to a suspected-but-hard-to-detect race condition in conda on Windows, which manifested in many parallel environment activations (one for each simulation process) on this platform. For the time being, users are advised to execute big parallelized simulations (we're talking thousands of simulations in an ABC setting) on unix systems. (PR #182)

  • slendr now allows recording of specific singular samples under unique names. See the documentation to schedule_sampling() for an example. (PR #181)

  • The dependency rnaturalearth has introduced some low-level changes that required minor tweaks to slendr's spatial internals. Thanks to @PMassicotte for his kind help on fixing this! (PR #180)

  • Fixed an issue with setting lock = TRUE in the set_range() function (issue #176 reported by @Sgornard -- thank you!). (#6d01e407)

  • If a non-spatial population is created which has a spatial parent population, slendr gives an informative error message. (#6bb646)

  • plot_model() now uses the same color for population ranges and population labels. (#c54632e5)

  • plot_map() can now optionally visualize splits in a spatial setting (#4664388c)

  • plot_model() now plots y-axis time using a more readable integer scale. (#6b0e7fcc)

creators.name: Ben Haller
creators.affiliation: Cornell University, Stick Software

metadata.title: Fig. 12 in Two new Pristimantis (Anura: Strabomantidae) of the P. lacrimosus species group from the eastern Guiana Shield lowlands
metadata.description: Fig. 12. Geographic distribution of Pristimantis flavus sp. nov. (yellow circles) and P. fouqueti sp. nov. (red circles). Stars indicate the type localities of each species.

metadata.title: Research Software Directory (as a service)
metadata.description: The Research Software Directory (as a service) is a content management system that is tailored to research software. Its main goal is to increase the visibility, impact and reuse of research software.
